data.title: Robert Charles Wilson – Audio Books, Best Sellers, Author Bio
data.meta_description: Learn more about Robert Charles Wilson. Browse Robert Charles Wilson’s best-selling audiobooks and newest titles. Discover more authors you’ll love listening to on Audible.
data.text:
Burning Paradise

By: Robert Charles Wilson

Narrated by: Scott Brick

Length: 11 hrs and 38 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4 out of 5 stars 140

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 130

Story

4 out of 5 stars 131

Cassie Klyne, 19 years old, lives in the United States in the year 2015 - but it's not our United States, and it's not our 2015....

1 out of 5 stars

Annoyingly Bad

Scott Warden is a man haunted by the past - and soon to be haunted by the future. In early 21st-century Thailand, Scott is an expatriate slacker.....

A haunting, beautiful work...

DIMINISHED EXPECTATIONS

In the near future of Robert Charles Wilson's Last Year, the technology exists to open doorways into the past - but not our past, not exactly. Each "past" is effectively an alternate world....

3 out of 5 stars

well-written, well-narrated, but...

Unabridged

Lise Adams is a young woman attempting to uncover the mystery of her father's disappearance ten years earlier. Turk Findley is an ex-sailor and sometimes-drifter. They come together when an infall of cometary dust seeds the planet with tiny remnant Hypothetical machines....

1 out of 5 stars

From Hypothertical to Pathetic , let down!

To join one of the 22 Affinities is to change one's life. It's like family, and more than family. Your fellow members aren't just like you, and they aren't just people who are likely to like you....

4 out of 5 stars

Owning the Unknown

A Science Fiction Writer Explores Atheism, Agnosticism, and the Idea of God

By: Robert Charles Wilson

Narrated by: Pete Cross

Length: 6 hrs and 25 mins

Unabridged

Overall

5 out of 5 stars 1

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 1

Story

5 out of 5 stars 1

All great science fiction has used the human imagination to explore that realm beyond the known, just as theistic religions have done since long before the genre existed. In Owning the Unknown, Hugo Award-winning author Robert Charles Wilson makes the case for what he calls intuitive atheism....

5 out of 5 stars

A refreshing look at the lack of theism

By S. R. Neidenbach on 01-25-24

Here is an unabridged audio collection of the "best of the best" science fiction short stories published in 2009 by current and emerging masters of the genre, as narrated by top voice talents....

1 out of 5 stars

Not a great year...
